Purpose.text: The purpose of this web page is to create clarity and freedom of access to information provided by the Office of Technology Transfer(OTT) to their clients and to allow their clients to update their personal contact information so more complete records can be kept.
This Project Definition Document provides a brief overview of Inventor Access Portal to promote a shared understanding of it before a more detailed Plan and Schedule are created.

Problem.text:
1. Clients of the Office of Technology Transfer are not able to access the data involving their current patent status or other information without first contacting the Office of Technology Transfer which can be time consuming and is not instantaneous.
  2. Contact information often requires change throughout the life of the patent and if not properly updated causes issues with identifying or contacting a project team member.

To allow associates of the Office of Technology Transfer are not able to access the data involving their current patent status or other information without first contacting the Office of Technology Transfer which can be time consuming and is not instantaneous. A lack of a proper email on the current servers can cause issues with identifying a project team member and often requires change throughout the life of the project which can cause confusion.

Goal.text:
1. Create a website to give inventors the ability to access their data without the need to contact someone from the Office of Technology Transfer by email or phone
  2. Allow the users of this web portal to change personal contact information and update the Database to reduce the amount of manual data entry into the Database by the Office of Technology Transfer
  3. Keep the site and data transfer secure at all times

Create a website that can be used by inventors/project of the Office of Technology Transfer the ability to access their data without the need to contact someone from the office by email or phone. Allow the users of this web portal to change certain personal data on the server such as email.

Objectives.text:
1. Enable clients to view the current status of their patents
  2. Allow clients to update their personal contact information
  3. Facilitate secure transfer of data from the Databases located in either SIUC, SIUE, or SIU School of medicine; to the user
  4. Allow new users of the web portal to create login information without the need for human intervention

• Create a login page
  • Access and get data securely from the database
  • Display data in a style consistent with that of the Office of Technology Transfer
  • Display only data the user is authorized to view
  • Allow a user to change his/her email, username, and password
  • Facilitate the transfer of users into the system using a verification system

Scope.text:
1. Create a login page to facilitate the security of the system
  2. Create a new user sign up to facilitate the entry of sign in data without the need for human intervention
  3. Develop the data retrieval tools which use access one of the Access Databases in either SIUC, SIUE, or SIU School of medicine
  4. Display projects in a readable format
  5. Develop search/filtering of projects
  6. Style webpages in the same format as the Office of Technology Transfers’ main site
  7. Allow reports to be ran on the users projects to facilitate clarity of data

This document contains a description of the functionality for the website Inventor Access Portal”, and within the sections below we have outlined what our end goal is and how to achieve that goal.

Description of some of the sections:

  • Key stakeholders: Those with the largest investment in the project
  • Functional Requirements: What sort of functionalities should be included in the website, and what are the restrictions on those requirements
  • Non-functional Requirements: What is expected out of the website but is not an action taken
  • Technical requirements:What sort of technical specification must hold true on the website

Success Criteria.text:
1. The product shall provide a website that is clear, concise, secure and displays all the data that is necessary for the licensing and patent information about the projects the user is a member of.
  2. The product will remain secure and all user data will be encrypted and under no immediate danger from a man in the middle attack.

This project shall provide a website that is clear, concise, secure and provides all the data that is necessary for the licensing and patent information about the projects the user has. The product shall also match the livery of the Office of Technology Transfer’s main site.

Assumptions.text:
• Users must be currently in the system OTT database system
  • Each user will have at least one project with either a pending or final status

• Users must be currently in the system
  • Each user will have at least one project with either a pending or final status

Constraints.text:
• Users must not be allowed to access data for a project they are not a part of
  • The database will not be modified heavily to support this web application
  • Data must be sourced from an Access database located in 3 distinct geo-locations as follows: SIUC, SIUE, or SIU School of medicine

• Users must not be allowed to access data for a project they are not a part of
  • The database will not be modified heavily to support this web application
  • We must use an Access database

Risks.text:
• Not being able to properly encrypt/decrypt data during transfer to and from the database
  • Blocking calls for data transfer to and from Access could create a bottleneck for the number of Access queries we can use at any given time
  • Security requirements enforced by SIU not being met by this project could put the site at risk of being shut down

We can mitigate these risks by researching the best ways to write Access function calls and developing our application with SIU security in mind.

• There is not enough communication between both the developers and the stakeholders
  • Assumptions about being able to change certain database features
  • Scope/feature creep in the project

We can mitigate these risks by discussing changes before being implemented and staying focused on the desired features of the webpage which are listed in this document.

Data Elements Info.text: We will be using the current Access database used by the Office of Technology Transfer plus additional text fields, email, username, and password.

Email.text:
• Should be in form: user@domain.tld, where tld is top level domain
  • Should be Unique
  • Should be verified as safe, I.E. injection free

Username.text:
• Should be Unique
  • Should be longer than 3 characters
  • Should be verified as safe, I.E. injection free

Password.text:
• Should be sent as encrypted
  • Should be stored as encrypted
  • Should be longer than 5 characters
  • Should contain at least one special character (#,!,@,$,&,?)
  • Password requirements subject to change
